question.title: How do I count the number of occurrences of a char in a String?
question.body:
I have the string 

a.b.c.d

I want to count the occurrences of '.' in an idiomatic way, preferably a one-liner.

(Previously I had expressed this constraint as "without a loop", in case you're wondering why everyone's trying to answer without using a loop).

answers.body:
Java 9+

You can use Matcher#results to get a Stream<MatchResult> and then use Stream#count to get the desired result.

Pattern.compile(Pattern.quote(searchStr))
       .matcher(str)
       .results()
       .count()

where str is "a.b.c.d" and searchStr is "." in your case.

Demo:

import java.util.regex.Pattern;

public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String str = "a.b.c.d";
        String searchStr = ".";
        System.out.println(
                Pattern.compile(Pattern.quote(searchStr))
                        .matcher(str)
                        .results()
                        .count());
    }
}

Output:

3
